title: Auto upload, exif problem
body:
### Actual behaviour

When the app automatically upload a picture after it's been taken, the exif of the image file indicate the date of the upload, not the original date and time of the picture.

If the upload succeed imediately after the photo shoot, there is not big problem. But when the upload fails, the exif of the image indicate the datetime of the retried upload, not the original exif.
### Expected behaviour

The exif of an uploaded image should always be the original one. Else, it mess up the order and the chronology and it's a problem.
### Environment data

Android version: up to date.

Device model: One Plus One

Stock or customized system: Cyanogen

ownCloud app version: up to date.

ownCloud server version: 9.0.1

title: Handle file firewall forbidden message and show it to the user.
body: Currently Android client is not showing the user what happened if the server blocks access by firewall. To block the Android client add a rule in the file firewall of the server (enterprise only) like this: ![screen shot 2016-08-02 at 16 39 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9048796/17332625/ad6c6eda-58cf-11e6-9c72-ee8b187215a1.png) For example the desktop client blocked by firewall: cc: @davivel

title: Edit options in federated sharing
body:
Android app does not handle the three edit options (create, change, delete) in federated sharing for folders.

Server v9.1 (not previous) already does it, so it is a needed improvement.

Related iOS issue: https://github.com/owncloud/ios/issues/751

title: Add flag to disable suggestions in password field, no matter if visib…
body:
…le or not

--- EDITED after further discussion ---

Some devices with custom IMEs (soft keyboards) apparently do not respect the flags set for username and password input field. More specifically, the property `android:inputType="textNoSuggestions"` is not observed in some HTC and Sony devices, and additionally a white space is added to the end of the username, though autocompletion property is not set for that field. This last point is specially annoying, and leads to failed logins.

title: Changed delay of the runnable in startSyncFolderOperation adding 350ms.
body: Added a further 350ms delay before the execution of the runnable in the startSyncFolderOperation method, so as to ensure that a refresh of the folder data will happen. The 350ms delay is a pure product of experimentation, and so may be adjusted according to the needs.

title: Auto Sync all Files
body:
### Files get synced if I open the file

I changed foo.txt on my desktop PC. The next day I want to see this change
on my mobile device. But the change was not on the device yet. I needed
internet connection during opening foo.txt
### Expected behaviour

I want my device to sync (up and download) the whole account automatically.

Background: I want to have my updated files in a wireless area (for example in a train). It is
too late if the android app tries to sync the file when I open it. This needs to be done
at home, before I leave.

I want this for all files of a given account.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Edit file on PC
2. Wait some hours (For me syncing once an hour would be a good default)
3. Switch of internet connection at android device
4. New content is not available :-(
### Environment data

Android version: 4.1.2

Device model: Samsung Galay S2

Stock or customized system: stock

ownCloud app version: 2.0.1

ownCloud server version: Where can I see this?

title: File Upload fails sometimes for some files, App 2.0.1, OC 9.0.3
body:
### Actual behaviour
#### Configuration

OwnCloud is configured with a base path /owncloud using docker image mwaeckerlin/owncloud:

```
docker run -d --name owncloud-mysql-volume mysql sleep infinity
docker run -d --name owncloud-volume mwaeckerlin/owncloud sleep infinity
docker run -d --name owncloud-mysql -e MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=somePassWord -e MYSQL_DATABASE=owncloud -e MYSQL_USER=owncloud -e MYSQL_PASSWORD=someOtherPassWord --volumes-from owncloud-mysql-volume owncloud-mysql-volume
docker run -d --name owncloud -e BASEPATH=/owncloud -e WEBROOT=/owncloud -e URL=some.url -e UPLOAD_MAX_FILESIZE=16G -e MAX_INPUT_TIME=7200 --volumes-from owncloud-volume --link owncloud-mysql:mysql
```

In front of OwnCloud, there is a Nginx reverse proxy, that does SSL (with a valid certificate), and redirects http to https, using docker image mwaeckerlin/reverse-proxy, the relevant part here is:

```
docker run -d --name reverse-proxy -p 443:443 -p 80:80 --link owncloud:some.url%2fowncloud [...] mwaeckerlin/reverse-proxy
```

I configures instant upload, also from mobile.
#### What Happens

Some files succeed, some files fail. I don't see any major difference between those files. Sometimes files do upload after some numbers of retrials, some did not (yet), even so I retried many many times.

Upload bar goes to 100%, then fails.

Uploads may fail regardless whether they are triggered by the instant upload or manually by using «share» with the OwnCloud app.
### Expected behaviour

All files always succeed.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Try to share some files, sometimes it works, sometimes it does not.

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)

Since it is an occasional behaviour, I can't really test that.
### Environment data

Android version: 5.1, 6.0.1,.5.1.1

Device model: Sony XPeria Z3 Compact, Xperia M5, Xperia Z2 tablet

Stock or customized system: -

ownCloud app version: 2.0.1

ownCloud server version: 9.0.3
### Logs
#### Web server error log

Funny, upload just succeeded, when I wanted to get the logs for the failure. This after about 10-20 fails for the same file.

So here you see all the logs for the file where I replaced the original file name by _filename_ and the external IP by _66.66.66.66_. The first attempts were fails, the last attempt was successful:

On Nginx:

- After select share option on a file or folder , we are not able to find any user to share. Does not matter local users or fed share.
### Expected behaviour
- After select share option on a file or folder, we should be able to find users and share the item with them.

1.  Long touch on a file or folder
2.  Select Share option
3.  Type a user or user@remote

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
yes

title: App crashes browsing with grid view
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a new folder
2. Browse into the folder (do not upload anything)
3. Set Grid View
4. Tap on back arrow to browse parent folder
### Actual behaviour

App crashes
### Expected behaviour

App browses to parent folder
### Environment data

Android version: checked in 5 and 6

Device model: Nexus5 and Nexus 9

ownCloud app version: 2.0.1 and `master` branch

ownCloud server version: 9.0

title: Client not tolerant of file being deleted while it's uploading to InstantUpload
body:
Took a short video, and then deleted it. I believe I must have done the delete right after OC client started to auto-upload it.

Client right now in notification bar showing "-202776000% Uploading ...."

It's also not clear to me that it's even going to finish/terminate. It appears to have stopped crazily updating the percentage, but is also still just sitting there saying it's uploading.

title: No refresh when app starts
body:
### Actual behaviour

Sometimes when the application starts the root folder is not refreshed, and a manual refresh is required. This is verified, because execution will not enter the if(hasWindowFocus()) statement in startSyncFolderOperation method in FileDisplayActivity.java. The issue cannot be reproduced every time. Increasing the delay applied to the runnable, for example to DELAY_TO_REQUEST_OPERATIONS_LATER + 500 fixes the problem. 
### Expected behaviour

The application should refresh the root folder when it is started.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Compile the application
2. Start the owncloud application a good number of times, at least 10.

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
YES
### Environment data

Android version:
4.0.4
Device model: 
Xperia Arc
Stock or customized system:
Cyanogenmod 9.1.0
ownCloud app version:
2.0.1
ownCloud server version:
9.0.2 (irrelevant, can be reproduced with 8.2)

title: "Select all" files option in multiselection mode
body: In #1176 multi select feature was developed and to avoid wasting time selecting all files in a folder one by one, an option to select all the files in a folder is necessary. This will let us select all files in a unique click.

title: Include "Available offline" option in multiselection mode
body:
In #1176 multi select feature was developed and it is needed to have also available the "Available offline" option when multiselection mode.

In a first iteration it would be only files (not folders, so that this feature is not fully implemented):

If any of the selected are av. offline -> all become av. offline
If some of the selected are av. offline and some are not -> the already av. offline remain as av. offline, and the not av. offline become av. offline. At the end all selected files are av. offline
If all the selected are already av. offline -> option "Not av. offline" to unset them as av. offline

title: As an user I want to be able to enable/disable "can share" option for FEDERATED shares if OC server is >=9.1
body:
AC:
- Only if OC server is >= 9.1
- The checkbox "can share" will be visible and enabled for federated shares
- By default the checkbox will be checked.
- Whenever the user updates the value of the checkbox, a request to update the permission "can share" on the federated share will be triggered.

-Related https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/22122#issuecomment-228028647

---

BUGS & IMPROVEMENTS
- [X] "Can Share" disabled by default https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1725#issuecomment-236129243 [FIXED]
- [X] "Can Share" disables "Can Edit" https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1725#issuecomment-236151088 [FIXED]

title: Authentication based in token (OAuth2)
body:
#Login will be done via OAuth2 protocol when server version supports it. 

AC: 
- [x] Setup params
- - [x] Move oauth2_configuration.xml params to setup.xml
- - [x] Move grant_type and response_type from setup.xml to code as variables and delete unneeded param oauth2_scope
- - [x] Delete oauth2_redirect_scheme param
- [x] Including OAuth2 authentication method
- - [x] Extend detection of authentication method to consider servers accepting more than one method at the same time (more than one challenge header can be received in responses).
- - [x] Compare authentication methods supported by the server and the app, and choose one of them to start with.
- - [x] Embed log-in process into WebView instead of trusting in external web browser
- - [x] Get OAuth2 acess token from captured redirection
- - [x] Silently use refresh token to get an access token on expiration instead of redirecting to log-in view.
- - - [x] The access token expiration is not working properly together with cookie session, see owncloud/core#28336.
- - [x] Redirect to log-in view / notification on top bar bar if refresh token doesn't get a new access token.
- - [x] Grant that when log-in view is opened with a given account, the only possible authentication method is the same previously used for that account. 
- - [x] Show an error if the user enters credentials of other user when updating an OAuth2 account
- - [X] Allow user to select authentication method (OAuth2 or Basic Auth) - NICE2HAVE [WON'T FIX]
- [x] UI/UX
- - [x] Make some modifications in the view either portrait or landscape mode.
- - [x] Show only url field in the first app launch and adapt user and password fields depending on the authentication method.
- - ~~[ ] Show always the embedded refresh button so that the user knows what to do next after having written down the url and connect button is disabled? Already implemented on iOS. NICE2HAVE~~
- - [x] Grant that 'enter' key in soft keyboard starts server check after URL is typed
- - [x] Connect button doesn't look like disabled, use other color or show a toast when the user clicks on it.
- - [x] Delete progress message about OAuth2 log-in when web dialog is cancelled

Forget the following description and comments about it. Jump after https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1724#issuecomment-262477717

~~Server version 9.1 will include this new feature that will make mobile apps adapt its login view to this new authentication mode.~~

~~The user generates a token in the web admin console (personal section). That token identifies unequivocally the account, so using only the token the user can login in his/her account. He could use the usual method user/password as well.~~

~~To do:~~

~~Actually, if the token is input in the password field the authentication works, but as username is displayed the string that the user input in the correspondent field, whatever he/she inputs. With the same token we can add so many instances of the same accounts as we wish. 
Only one instance of each account, with the username/displayname of the user should be displayed.~~

~~Doubts:~~
~~- How to take the authentication method to be used: from a branding variable (as, for example, saml), or asking the server for that.~~ 
~~- Login view: what to do with username field. If the user input a token in password field, the username field is irrelevant, but must remain due to accounts in other servers that do not require tokens.~~ 
~~- Edit credentials: for a new generated token? tokens are overrided, a new one invalidates the previous in spite of the accounts added with those tokens keeps on being valid. Changing the account password invalidate all the generated tokens.~~

___

title: Create a ThumbImageView
body:
Thumbnails of images are currently shown in 3 different places. The uploadlist, the local file browser and the normal folder view of an nextcloud folder.

The code to generate a thumbnail / kickof the thumbnail generation is present in all of there places.

To unify this, i would like to propose a ThumbImageView class which subclases ImageView. This Class should handle all concern regarding File or OCFile -> Thumbnail, by calling ThumbManager and so on.

The ImageView objects are reused in the list views, all code accesing these Views has to check whether the reference they use, still refer to a View with the initial File, this could be solved by having a Reference to OCFile or File on the ThumbImageView aswell as the unique thumbnail CacheKey!

So we have some new methods like
void setFile(File file);
void setOCFile(OCFile file);
int getCacheKey(); (maybe override .hashCode(), but this could be problematic with OCFiles not existing)

Another possibility would be to introduce two additional classes
FileThumbImageView and OCFileThumbImageView.. As far as i understand it, the Upload Queue and local filebrowser lists use File and the nextcloud folder browser uses OCFile..

This should only a refactor not any addition of new functionality.

title: Enable Multi-Window mode
body:
The multi-window is a new interface design in Android devices available from Android N API (https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1675), to keep in the screen more than one application.

There are two different modes in mult-window interface: multiple app mode, and picture-in-picture.

I suggest to implement the compatibility as a first approach to adapt our interface, because I think the picture-in-picture may not gives much functionality to the ownCloud app.

https://developer.android.com/preview/features/multi-window.html

title: Adapt to Doze
body:
Doze (1) can disable network access at any moment, once the screen is off. This could result in pending uploads or downloads being abruptly interrupted (and not automatically retried, at this moment).

We need to study (experiment) the real impact on our app and adapt to it.

(1) https://developer.android.com/training/monitoring-device-state/doze-standby.html

UPDATE:

Doze (from Android 6) and App Standby (from Android 7) disable access to network when some conditions are met. These conditions never apply when apps are open, but the ownCloud Android app does a lot of work in background. 

Main problems we detected are about pending uploads interrupted, and never retried again - simply left as failed in the uploads view, and leaving the task of retrying them for the user. Downloads can be easily interrupted too, but the feedback we have from users is focused in uploads, probably because uploading multiple files at once is a use case more common than downloading multiple files at once.

Another operation that might be interrupted is automated sync of full account, but this is retried by the system automatically, shouldn't be a problem. Besides, we have no feedback saying otherwise.

Solution applied is scheduling retries of uploads and downloads failed due to lack of network, using the JobScheduler to do it whenever Wifi network is available. We "hardcoded" the requirement of Wifi to make it available sooner, but we expect to make this detail configurable by the user in the scope of #41. 

It is worth to say that retries will not be done as soon as the Wifi is back. Android system will decide when exactly the retry is done, granting that Wifi network is available. This is a constrain imposed by JobScheduler, and a trend that Google is introducing step by step. More constrains in this sense are coming with Android O, and we'll need to assume that we'll have less and less control over background operation.

____

BUGS & IMPROVEMENTS

 Downloads

- [X]  Crash when tapping on notification https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1684#issuecomment-291542941 [FIXED] @davigonz , @jesmrec 
- [X] Switching the device off does not resume the downloads https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1684#issuecomment-292171604 [FIXED] @davigonz @jesmrec 
- [X] With no connection loss, restarting the device does not resume https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1684#issuecomment-294431219
- [X] SSL initialization failed https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1684#issuecomment-292456651 [FIXED]
- [X] Not all downloads resumed https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1684#issuecomment-292469463  [FIXED]
- [X] Android 6: downloads stucked https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1684#issuecomment-294718015 [FIXED]
- [X] Android 5: Download interrupted is never resumed https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1684#issuecomment-295275970  [FIXED]
- [X] Android 5: Instant uploads get freezed after a connection loss https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1684#issuecomment-295306015 [FIXED] @davivel

 Uploads

https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1684#issuecomment-294438205

body:
When I'm taking pictures, I usually take a couple and choose the best out of them afterwards. But by the time I've chosen my favorite and deleted the other copies, owncloud already uploaded all pictures. So now I have to delete 6 pictures in the client (which is tedious, because there doesn't seem to be multi select.)

I would love to have a setting where I can set a delay (5mins, 15mins or 30mins for example) to upload the pictures. If the photo is still there by then, upload it, if it isn't, delete the queue entry.

For everybody finding this on Google until it might be implemented: I solved this by using FolderSync (or any other sync app) I use anyways and upload the pictures every 30mins. Sometimes I take them right before an upload cycle, but most of the time it works just fine.

title: Android N Updates
body:
Problem: Android N is coming out in October, and we need to prepare the ownCloud app to work with the expected changes.

In fact, we are expecting a few changes, many largely due to the concern of Android to conserve batteries.

The big issues we know of are:
- The current instant uploads approach will no longer work.

The alternative is the media store, so we need to switch to use it. BUT, it is not clear how immediate the notifications are so it might not be immediate instant uploads.
- The synchronization of the accounts will also not work because of the loss of the background

The DOZE subsystem from Android 6 continues with ownCloud (designed to save battery life), but gets worse in N from our perspective. When the phone is left alone, and even moving but the screen is dark, after a some period of time makes other systems not available, such as the network. This means uploads in progress will be killed. A user can then reactivate them manually in ownCloud, but we need to deal with the fact that at any moment the system can interrupt the network, and thus kill sync and uploads/downloads.

Users can disable Doze as well, but this is not ideal. However, a user can be asked this with a redirect to the system dialog about turning off Doze.

One alternative for instant uploads is to create a service that is watching the folder for changes, and then we know immediately when a photo appears (solves 1). But then the second problem with Doze happens, and we need to figure out how to deal with it.

Perhaps we can use the new chunking and add pause/resume capability, and chunk handling, so that when Doze interrupts the network, the app is able to resume rather than restart the upload.

Ideal dev end state:
1) Create a service that watches the file/folder for cnahges
2) Update the uploader to be able to work in the short active windows between when Doze is on
3) Add the ability for the pause and resume of uploads using the new 9.1 chunking, as well as older ownCloud instances. This likely means chunking and pause/resume will only be enabled on servers 9.1 or newer, and for older servers pause resume is not possible. (maybe)
4) We need to consider how we resume downloads or we have the same problem as well for a synced folder / favorites

Effort: This is a major effort when combined. Individually, this is also large individually.

Conceivably this could be just a little later than the release of Android N.

@davivel 

---

And @davivel was here:

Problems to fix:
- [x] Pictures / videos taken with the mobile need to be added automatically to OC if the user enable 'instant uploads : #6 ; related also: #744
- [x] Adapt to Doze; this will require some direct experimentation, "Doze mode" may be enforced with development tools: #1684

Automatic tests
body: Set up environment and added first sample automatic tests for the Android app.

title: Auto test espresso
body: nice code

title: Add instantupload behaviour copy
body:
I was set options as follow:
  Original file will be..  = "kept in original folder"
  "Upload pictures via wifi only" = off

When I took a picture without wifi, Owncloud app uploads the picture with 3G.
And I want to look the picture with Owncloud app(I love grid view),
Owncloud app downloads the picture with _3G_.

So I think that need "copied to app folder" option.
This is the reason that I made this PR.

title: 2.0.0 - favorite setting is not remembered
body:
### Expected behaviour

When I select a file as favorite, it should remain such until I unselect it.
### Actual behaviour

I select a file as favorite.
I change the local file.
The file gets uploaded correctly.
The favorite check disappears and the file is no longer favorite.
### Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Nexus 5

Stock or customized system:
Stock
ownCloud app version:
2.0.0
ownCloud server version:
9.0

title: Auto upload new files in synced folder
body:
### Expected behaviour

When I edit a file on android that was downloaded via Owncloud it uploads the changed file. But a new file created under an existing directory downloaded by Owncloud is not uploaded.
### Actual behaviour

The new file is ignored. It's not even visible in the owncloud client.
### Steps to reproduce
1. download a folder using the Owncloud android app
2. open some app to create a new file in the Owncloud managed directory
3. be disappointed that the file does not show up on the server.

I would have expected this to be covered by #3 but as that's closed....
Some discussion about this was in  #1136 ... but it was suggested to create a new issue for this specific feature.
### Environment data

Android version: 6.x

Device model: nexus 5

Stock or customized system: stock

ownCloud app version: 2.x beta 20160427

title: First image in queue fails to upload once the device connected to a WiFi network
body:
### Expected behaviour

All images I took while not connected to a WiFi network should be uploaded once I connect to a WiFi network.
### Actual behaviour

The upload of the first image in the queue fails. No problem with the other images.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Turn off WiFi
2. Snap 4 pictures
3. Turn on WiFi
4. Error message appears
### Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?

Yes
### Environment data

Android version: 5.1.1

Device model: Nexus 5

Stock or customized system: Cyanogenmod

ownCloud app version: 2.0.0

ownCloud server version: ownCloud 9.0.2 (stable)
